title: So... if Lee is so freelo, why not become Challenger with him???
body:
???
Honest question.
I want a discussion.

replies.body: "If they're so overpowered why don't you just play them?" isn't an argument
Why not? If they were actually overpowered, you'd think that a lot more people would play or ban him and climb?

> [{quoted}](name=nep2une,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=boywYN9i,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-11-23T19:52:44.317+0000)

I mean... he is by far the most played jungler in the game, with twice the playrate of the second most played jungler, Kha'Zix. His ban rate is relatively high, and his win rate is actually really high for the highest skill cap champion in the game.

But like, why not just pick anyone else who performs far better without needing to be as good with him?
And banrate isn't always necessarily related to actual strength. It's related to perception of strength more.
Same with playrate.

So like, for example... if you wanted a jungler, why not play Ivern/Hecarim/Vi/etc and others who synergize with the new CoC Keystone far better?
Or for those with high playrates and winrates, Vayne/Janna/Twitch/Ahri/Hecarim/etc?

Lee Sin is fairly strong and good in good hands. But I think that's about it.
Even with a kit like his, he's still managing to perform worse than multiple others.
Yes, it's probably a tad too high for his difficulty level, similar to Vayne at the moment, but I don't think it's worth all the hollering and screaming people are doing recently.

Also, the new jungle hurt others a lot more than it hurt him, which was the main reason Lee became better this patch, since he himself didn't really receive any changes.

because you put some on the other under powered champions on good hands and they don't perform in levels similar to lee sin. 
Take for example Vi, she has a skillcap slighly lower than Lee Sin and they perform identical roles on a team at pretty much all stages of the game. If you put two equally good players (on their respective champion) the lee sin on will get the edge simply becuase he is lee sin.
Im sad that kha'zix gets spammed, I have to rely on yi now >:(

I'm not saying anything about Lee in particular, I'm just saying that's not an argument.

Say someone complains about Riven or Draven being overpowered.
What does saying "If they're so overpowered why don't you just play them?" actually accomplish?
Its implying one of two things:
A) That the champion is hard to play (which isn't really an excuse for excess power)
or
B) That the player only thinks that champion is overpowered because they are bad or have never played the champion, in which case you should simply tell them that because its more direct and not as unbearably snarky.

I don't have a strong opinion on Lee Sin right now, I just needed to put this out there.

the problem with lee that people subconsciously have is that he is very forgiving when you make mistakes. you have the highest base MS in the game, two of the longer re positioning abilities built into his kit, making him hard to catch for just about anyone even when he is in terrible positioning.

All of those extremely weak champions typically rot in low diamond, no matter whose playing them. 

And in challenger, unless you're already way up in challenger playing a weak champion will get you demoted out of challenger fast. And climbing with a weak champion in diamond will net you an extremely poor winrate that is all for intents and purposes wasting time.

For ex:

I made it to around D3 as Kindred in a very bad meta while she's weak af. But I lost every single game I was up against Gragas/ Zac and broke even on Graves games, but only because I am often a much much better jungler than the plat 5 skill level Graves player abusing freelo. But often times he can be absolutely terrible and win anyways becausehis champ was brain damage proof. 

I very very very very easily could have hit d2-1 if I put all of my effort on Graves/Zac/Gragas. Instead I sit tilted in D5 playing at 4 am watching my challenger players intentionally run down mid to die because I picked a terrible champ I.E Kindred.

In middle lane. The best possible strength they have is how fast they can clear caster minions. Aurelion and Taliyah were able to do this at level 1 faster than anyone else, it made them broken S+tier.

Jungle: It's how fast they can clear birds so that they can outspeed the other jungle to gank faster. Currently Ivern is one of the best because of this. He can be level 4 ganking while you're still level 2 fucking with birds. 

Adc: It boils down to the meta. The current meta is assassin fotm, so naturally Vayne is broken + she has a numbers advantage. In a poke meta Varus usually reigns supreme.  Early game metas usually turn to Lucian due to his abusive snowbally nature against other adcs. 

Support: if it's a lane meta, Zyra reigns suprement. But a roaming meta Bard and Ali usually take charge. 

Top lane: usually boils down to very gimmicky bullshit. But the current meta is who can afk farm to get zzrots and mindlessly shove. At the current moment Yorick and Nasus are basically Gods at this. 

These are usually what determine the champion pools of the meta. But give or take numbers shifts popularity. 

Cass and Syndra are insanely powerful due to their wave clear + utility + assassination potential. So naturally, Ziggs is coming back because he can wave clear just like them while also afking under turret so he can't feed.  So, the very reason people pick cass and syndra he prevents, while also being able to gank with ult. 

It's also why I'm going full AD Reksai in the jungle. People are picking fotm assassins, more commonly known farming champions. I pick Reksai who as full ad has one of the fastest clears in the game + really strong burst potential and I can quite frankly take complete control of the game before the majority of the other champs can even get enough items to deal with me because Rek'sai is one of the most cost efficient junglers in that I don't need items to  pull off good damage/what I need to do. All I need to start taking charge of the game is 1200 gold.  No other jungler can take the game under the belt with that little gold. It'll take a good while for people to catch on to this, and 90% of the Reksai players, save for like a very small hand full will actually acknowledge this as well.  In fact, LoL's balance team hasn't caught on either and they're buffing Reksai x3.
